io.github.kkysen.quicktrip.apis

Class CachedApiRequest<R>

  • Object
    • CachedApiRequest<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - type of POJO representing the API response response, presumably a JSON one
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Request<R>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractJsonRequest

    public abstract class CachedApiRequest<R>
extends Object
implements Request<R>
    Author:
    Khyber Sen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  CachedApiRequest.KeyManager 
      static class  CachedApiRequest.QueryParams
      a QueryParams that encodes the name=value pairs in a query string extends LinkedHashMap to maintain insertion order
      static class  CachedApiRequest.RequestCache 
      private static class  CachedApiRequest.RuntimeIOException
      wraps an IOException into a RuntimeException

      private boolean isCached 
      private CachedApiRequest.QueryParams query 
      private static CachedApiRequest.RequestCache requestCache
      the one and only CachedApiRequest.RequestCache that caches all the requests made
      private R response 
      private static Thread SAVE_ON_EXIT
      a Thread that runs CachedApiRequest.RequestCache.save() added as a JVM shutdown hook so that it is saved whenever the program finishes
      private String url

    • Method Detail

      • getResponseClass

        protected abstract Class<? extends R> getResponseClass()
        Returns:
        the Class of type R of this request's response

      • getResponseType

        protected Type getResponseType()
        If getPojoClass does not work because of generics, return null. Then override this and return the Type.
        Returns:
        the Type (including generic type) of this request's response

      • getBaseUrl

        protected abstract String getBaseUrl()
        Returns:
        the base URL of the request (everything before the query string)

      • getOverridingUrl

        protected String getOverridingUrl()
        Returns:
        a complete URL that overrides all the other URL stuff null if no overriding URL

      • getApiKeyQueryName

        protected String getApiKeyQueryName()
        Returns:
        the name of the API key in the query string defaults to "key"

      • getApiKeys

        protected abstract List<String> getApiKeys()
        Returns:
        a list of API keys if null or an empty List are returned, then no API keys are used any nulls or empty Strings are interpreted as no API key

      • getRelativeCachePath

        protected abstract Path getRelativeCachePath()
        Returns:
        the relative Path of the directory in which this request should be cached. The absolute Path is "src/main/resources/apiCache/" + getRelativeCachePath().

      • getApiKey

        protected String getApiKey()

      • getUrl

        protected String getUrl()

      • getRefreshDuration

        protected Duration getRefreshDuration()
        If a cached response for this request is more than getRefreshDuration() old, then a new request is made.
        Returns:
        the Duration for how long a response is still valid defaults to 1 day

      • isExpired

        private boolean isExpired()
        Returns:
        true if the last cached request is expired (i.e. the time between now and the last cache is greater than getRefreshDuration())

      • isCached

        private boolean isCached()
        Returns:
        true if the response has been cached and is recent enough

      • setQueryWithApiKey

        private void setQueryWithApiKey()

      • setUrlWithApiKey

        private void setUrlWithApiKey()

      • findUrl

        private void findUrl()

      • reflectQuery

        protected void reflectQuery()
        uses reflection to find all the QueryFields and adds them to the query CachedApiRequest.QueryParams

      • modifyQuery

        protected void modifyQuery(CachedApiRequest.QueryParams query)
        allows a subclass to modify the final query before it's assembled into the final url without overriding, this method does nothing
        Parameters:
        query - the existing query with the reflected query fields and API key added

      • setQuery

        private void setQuery()

      • setUrl

        private void setUrl()

      • getFileExtension

        protected abstract String getFileExtension()
        Returns:
        the file extension for the cachePath of this request

      • deserializeFromFile

        protected abstract R deserializeFromFile(Path path)
                                  throws IOException
        called when the request has been cached
        Parameters:
        path - the Path of the file to be deserialized
        Returns:
        the cached response
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an exception reading the file

      • deserializeFromUrl

        protected abstract R deserializeFromUrl(String url)
                                 throws IOException
        called when the request hasn't been cached before
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the HTTP request whose response will be deserialized
        Returns:
        the response
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an HTTP error

      • cache

        protected abstract void cache(Path path,
                              R response)
                       throws IOException
        called when the request hasn't been cached before and after deserializeFromUrl(String) has been called
        Parameters:
        path - the Path to save the serialized file at
        response - the response to cache
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an exception caching the serialized file

      • setNonCachedResponse

        private void setNonCachedResponse()

      • clearResponse

        protected void clearResponse()

      • getResponse

        public R getResponse()
              throws IOException
        gets the response for this request If this request has already been made, then it deserializes R from the cached file. If this request hasn't been made before, then it deserializes R from the response to the HTTP request and then caches it.
        Specified by:
        getResponse in interface Request<R>
        Returns:
        the response for this request
        Throws:
        IOException - if anything goes wrong in cache(Path, Object), deserializeFromFile(Path), or deserializeFromUrl(String)
